title: Drawing, "Decorative Project for Central Tondo with Apollo, Autumn and Winter", ca. 1780
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over traces of graphite on cream laid paper
inscribed: Inscribed in black chalk on lower edge within roundel: IN APOLLINE. In black chalk above two upper lozenges: autunno. Below at bottom in black chalk: inverno.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Circular medallion representing Apollo playing lyre, flanked by two lozenges; at left, elderly drinker, Silenus, supported by young Diana with bow and quiver.  Figures shown obliquely from back. At left, beside medallion, pen sketch for tree stump surrounded by snake.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Decorative Project for Central Tondo with Apollo, Autumn and Winter", ca. 1780.
ca. 1780. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over traces of graphite on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3217.
